Description: Ostracon, large fragment (two pieces now joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and remains of twelve lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.86)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87587) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87587)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 88 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
